channel.title: Running NO-IP
channel.description:
So I want to host a server using NO-IP, it's so I can pass it to some irl friends etc etc..
Has anyone used this before?
People can't connect when I send the client out. I believe there may be port issues somewhere along the line although I have forwarded all port 43594 on my firewall and via my router. Distributed client has my IP and I use the standard IP, not sure where i'm going wrong.. Any help would be appreciated.
Thanks

item.title: Running NO-IP
item.dc:creator: @inspectah inspectah
item.description:
@inspectah wrote:

Tried all of this, It wont let me run it as its saying the IP is already in use. Had to resort to hamachi which is a bit shitty. Would’ve much preferred NO-IP :palm:

Read full topic

item.title: Running NO-IP
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

You have to put your no-ip as the client ip.

Read full topic
